title: 9News Sydney | Tuesday January 27 | Full Episode
description: Peter Overton leads the Sydney 9News bulletin with coverage of a historic political shift as new polling reveals Pauline Hanson outpacing Sussan Ley in the preferred Prime Minister stakes. He also reports on a severe weather emergency across the country, featuring record-breaking heatwaves and urgent bushfire evacuations in Victoria. National security and safety remain in focus as police hunt for a suspected triple killer in central-west New South Wales, and authorities investigate a major heroin bust at Brisbane Airport involving two Sydney men. The bulletin also covers the legal fallout from January 26 demonstrations, including a bomb scare in Perth and hate speech charges in Sydney, while providing a morale boost with the arrival of Australian athletes in Italy for the 2026 Winter Olympics. title: 9News Adelaide | Tuesday January 27 | Full Episode
description: South Australia is sweltering under a record-breaking heatwave as Adelaide endures its hottest night in history. In this bulletin, we cover the impact of the searing temperatures on local businesses and power grids, plus the excitement and challenges of students returning to school in 40-degree heat.  Beyond the weather, we bring you the latest on a violent teen assault in Elizabeth Downs, a family home destroyed by fire in Gillies Plains, and a significant breakthrough in the Middle East as the final Israeli hostage's remains are recovered from Gaza. title: 9News Brisbane | Tuesday January 27 | Full Episode
description: Tonight on 9News Queensland with Melissa Downes and Joel Dry, we lead with a devastating light plane crash at Jacobs Well on the Gold Coast that has claimed the lives of a veteran pilot and his friend. Investigative teams are on-site at the smoking wreckage to determine what caused the home-built aircraft to go down shortly after takeoff. Meanwhile, a major flood emergency is unfolding in North Queensland, where the town of Einasleigh has been inundated after record rainfall caused rivers to rise at a staggering rate of one meter per hour. Residents have been forced to flee to higher ground as emergency services struggle to reach isolated communities.
